--- German Viscuso <netquake@...> wrote:
> For those peolple interested in short term memory
> there's a recent article
> here:
> http://www.newscientist.com/news/news.jsp?

Yes, interesting.  Possibly the original work to which
they refer might have some applications for us.  OTOH,
whatever their topology was NEAT might be able to
evolve it, without knowing what they did.  I have no
doubt that NEAT can evolve nets with short term
memory.  What is not clear is how much memory, i.e.
given a reasonable amount of time for evolution, how
much data can be stored and retrieved.  It would also
depend on the manner of retrieval.

=====
Mitchell Timin
